text: The 2015 CONCACAF Gold Cup Final decided the winners of the 2015 CONCACAF Gold Cup. It was held on 26 July 2015 at Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia, and contested by Jamaica and Mexico. It was Jamaica's first final of a CONCACAF championship, and Mexico's 12th; they won a record 10th with a 3-1 victory. Mexico advanced to a one-match play-off, which was held on 10 October 2015, against the 2013 CONCACAF Gold Cup winners, the United States, for the opportunity to represent CONCACAF in the 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup in Russia. ==Route to the final== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !colspan=2 style="width:1*"|Jamaica !Round !colspan=2 style="width:1*"|Mexico |-bgcolor=#c1e0ff |width=30%|Opponents |width=14%|Result |width=14%|Group stage |width=30%|Opponents |width=14%|Result |- | align="left" | |2–2 |bgcolor="#c1e0ff"|Match 1 | align="left" | |6–0 |- | align="left" | |1–0 |bgcolor="#c1e0ff"|Match 2 | align="left" | |0–0 |- | align="left" | |1–0 |bgcolor="#c1e0ff"|Match 3 | align="left" | |4–4 |- |colspan="2" align=center valign=top|Group B winners |bgcolor="#c1e0ff"|Final standings |colspan="2" align=center valign=top|Group C runners-up |- valign="top" bgcolor="#c1e0ff" |Opponents |Result ||Knockout stage |Opponents |Result |- | align="left" | |1–0 |bgcolor="#c1e0ff"|Quarterfinals | align="left" | |1–0 (a.e.t.) |- | align="left" | |2–1 |bgcolor="#c1e0ff"|Semifinals | align="left" | |2–1 (a.e.t.) |} ==Match details== {| width=92% |- | | |} ==References== ;Notes ==External links== *CONCACAF Gold Cup, CONCACAF.com Final Category:CONCACAF Gold Cup finals Category:Jamaica national football team matches Category:Mexico national football team matches Category:July 2015 sports events in the United States Category:Sports competitions in Philadelphia Category:2015 in sports in Pennsylvania Category:2015 in Philadelphia
